newsitem.title: UK: Hartley, Eynon elected as LIFFE deputy chairmen.
newsitem.headline: Hartley, Eynon elected as LIFFE deputy chairmen.

text.p: The board of the London International Financial Futures and Options Exchange (LIFFE) said on Friday it had elected Christopher Hartley and re-elected Mark Eynon as its two deputy chairmen.

Hartley is managing director of Dean Witter International Ltd and has been responsible for the futures and options brokerage division of LIFFE since 1992. He has been a director of LIFFE since mid-1992 and is chairman of its strategy review group, the exchange said in a statement.
Michael Stiller, deputy chairman since 1995, did not seek re-election in order to give more time to the management of CAGF London, LIFFE said, but he will remain a member of the board.
Eynon is global head of exchange-traded derivatives at SBC Warburg, a division of Swiss Bank Corporation. He has been deputy chairman of LIFFE since July 1995.
